Reviews.Title: “The hotel needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: GMali
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel for 4 days. The location of the hotel is very good as it is on a quiet area and just 5 minutes from the circo massimo metro station. Depending on the room you may also have a balcony and a nice view at the hotel's yard. Rooms are of a good size, but they need a renovation since they seem really old and dirty. There is also a very unpleasant smell probably coming out from the dirty carpet. The hotel has free wi-fi connection, but the connection is awful and it is impossible to do your work, especially at peak time where everyone uses it. Breakfast is limited and it was the same every day, but you can have a very nice coffee prepared by a very polite employee In general i believe that this hotel is on a nice location,but it needs a renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Go there if you want to get robbed”
Reviews.Author: ash7789
Reviews.Content: Just checked out from this hotel yesterday. While I was out of my room, with the Do Not Disturb sign on the door, an employee entered my room and stole my laptop. When I asked the front desk person he couldn't care less and didn't try to help me or show any sympathy. He finally agreed to open up the doors to the maid's closet ... where my agenda book (removed from my purse) was sitting nicely on the shelf. I still never got my computer back but I will NEVER stay here or recommend this to anyone coming here again. It's a shame for the because I live in the neighborhood of the hotel (was just staying there w a friend as a "treat") so I have sent tons of guests their way, not anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Domus Aventina, Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dave E
Reviews.Content: A really nice hotel; quiet, clean, friendly, good value and convenient for the centre of Rome (about a 15-20 minute walk to the Colosseum). I stayed here on a business trip but would not hesitate to use this hotel if I return to Rome on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, staff, location”
Reviews.Author: awright1856
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a "very good" hotel. Staff are great. Location is solid- just a 5min walk from Ostiense for a train to the airport and Piramide metro station, from which you can take the metro all over town. Quiet location kind of out in the suburbs of a nice area of Rome. Many restaurants along Viale della Cestia Piramide to choose from, including a Mexican place with a great apertivo/happy hour. Great enoteca close to the intersection as you walk to Circo Massimo. My wireless did not work from my 4th floor room and the rooms, while spatious, are in need of a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “short autumn break”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary539
Reviews.Content: Easily accessible from stazione Ostiense. Taxi cost 5 euros for approx 5 minute journey. Very quiet and pretty location. Room good size; lovely patio/balcony looking onto beautiful courtyard. Good quality bed linen and towels. Excellent en suite; easy to use powerful shower with virtually intantly hot water. Towels replaced daily if required. Useful electronic safe and well stocked mini bar. Continental breakfast buffet available 7am-10am and serving probably the best freshly made coffee I've ever tasted! Location about a 10 min walk from Metro Circo Massimo and the journey to Termini costs 1 euro, takes about 5 mins or so and ticket valid on Metro system for 75 mins. Would use this hotel again on a return visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VC1321
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Domus Aventina. While a bit out of the way, the hotel is near the metro which makes it easy to navigate Rome. Location also meant the hotel was very quiet. The staff were all helpful and spoke excellent english. We arrived early before our room was ready and they invited us to have breakfast while we waited. Cappuccino's were great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LuceHenriette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domus Aventina for 6 nights in September. The room was quiet, clean with well functionning air conditionning. We had a room with a balcony overlooking a small courtyard where flowers, orange and olive trees were growing. Staff were pleasant, professional and helpful. It is worth booking a taxi through the hotel to get picked up at the airport and return. A number of good little restaurants are within walking distance to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you pay for and/or get the better rooms”
Reviews.Author: schnouk
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in June on a business trip. The location was excellent for me because I could walk to my place of work but as well because of its proximity to restaurants in the evening. The hotel is on a quiet street and staff are helpful. I had booked a single room at a great price through Trip Advisor but the room I was given initially was small, dank and dark with a single window giving onto the plumbing chute. I was able to negotiate an upgrade to a better room for about 20 euros additional per day. The room I was given had a lovely view over the garden to the church next door and was bright and quiet. I thought I was in a different hotel! My only critique is that the room had wall to wall carpet which is never a good idea in hotels particularly in hot climates: they always smell and are a repository for dirt, bugs and the rest despite the best efforts of vacuum cleaners. Being allergic to pollens, dust, mites, etc. I had to take my antihistamines before going to bed. My other critique is the breakfast: right up there with airline breakfasts! Awful synthetic juice and lousy coffee ... in Italy!!!! The gentleman taking care of breakfast was himself embarrassed. So what's the bottom line? Good hotel overall with a few drawbacks that one can live with if you get a good price. Easier to live with if you are on vacation (and can have plenty of wine to drink before going to bed) than on business (and can only take antihistamines because you have to work the next day).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very affordable!”
Reviews.Author: gdawh10
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in Domus Aventina during our stay in Rome in January 2011. Overall it was a really good experience. The location was excellent. It was a couple of blocks from the the Circus Maximus and a short walk to the Colosseum. The metro is about 2-3 blocks away which allows for really easy access to all of the major sites. The staff was friendly and helpful (especially when we were trying to get our lost luggage back from the airport). The room was nice with a very large bathroom by European standards.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: RobHarris101
Reviews.Content: We stayed from June 29, 2011 - July 6, 2011 and had the best time! It started with their airport transportation service. We chose to utilize the service and it was money well spent; the driver was very friendly and got us there in short order. The desk person was very friendly at check-in as was all their staff. very willing to help. Breakfast was a good start, not too much since the real joy of Roma is eating evening meal! Our room had a balcony and it was a real relaxer to sit there and drink a bottle of wine. The good location to the major sites and a bus trip to further away areas is a plus. The neighborhood location is ideal for relaxing and soaking in the city! Give this wonderful place consideration when looking for a good hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Aprill21
Reviews.Content: The hotel Domus Aventina is situated on top of one of 7 hills of Rome. It is nice residential area: quiet streets with beautiful gardens. The only noise we experienced during our stay was from a concert on Circus Maximus, which made us close all the windows, but that does not happen often as I understand. Rooms are quite spacious with small verandas facing the side wall of an old church which is right next to hotel. Bathrooms and rooms are very clean and well-furnished. The staff of hotel provided all that was necessary, so the level of service is very good. I would give the hotel five out of five, as we loved our stay in Rome, but there were several things that could be improved. I would say that hotel was quite expensive for us, even with the discount we received from tripadvisor, but that is my personal opinion, as we were able to get cheaper hotels of the same quality in other major cities of Italy. Of course, the position of the hotel is one of the reasons for such price. The breakfasts we had in the restaurant were nice: muesli, cornflakes, yogurts, croissants, boiled eggs, etc. ,although could be improved. As we are in Italy, I would prefer to see real cheese, not processed cheese that we were served, the same about ham, which was canned ham, not real meat. As it was summer, I would also expect to have some fruits for breakfast, and there were none. However, breakfasts were very pleasant thanks to the barista, who was very friendly, always smiling and singing along the songs, while preparing coffee)) Do: visit residential area to the south of Aventina, where you can experience real Italian life, also there are many small shops and cafes to visit, pizzeria that we really liked and it is just a nice place to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: Frankenyutz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a beautiful residential neighborhood very close to the Circo Massimo metro stop. My only complaint was that my room was very dark and small and the tiny patio, such as it was, opened out into a well where my only view was the bathroom window of two other rooms (see photo); also, the din of children playing at the school next door made afternoon siesta impossible. I would probably stay there again, but I would make sure I got a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected gem in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: ecioca
Reviews.Content: From the very first moment we got there we received a very friendly welcome from the Reception staff and everything we asked during our stay was not too much trouble. All of the things that we needed were available and the hotel staff was more than happy to help us. Special thanks to Andrea which was an amazing help for the first time Rome visitors like us. His advice on the places we should visit, the shortcuts we should take, the restaurants we should go to saved us time and money…Thanks Andrea! You made our stay most pleasant. We will always remember you and your enthusiasm. Excellent breakfast and well enough to keep us going for the full morning and part of the afternoon. The waitresses also were very polite and helpful. Excellent coffee, excellent croissants… Room was very comfortable, larger than expected with a very cozy balcony which faced a very nice inside garden. The bathroom was clean and updated. The room was cleaned every day. And last but not least: a very good position in an elegant neighborhood. Close to the most popular sites: within 5 min walking distance from the Circus Maximus, 20 min to Colosseum, 20 min to Vittorio Emanuelle and to the Capitollini Museum. It was a lovely hotel and we would certainly return there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Rome - will visit again”
Reviews.Author: cencible
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as my partner was attending a conference in the FAO building, two minutes away by foot. The cost of the stay was very reasonable and we were surprised by the high quality of the rooms and service. The rooms looked newly refurbished and the walls were padded with fabric, very luxurious! We slept very well, the hotel was very quiet. The hotel was positioned well for a base to explore the Colosseum etc. All in all one of the best finds we stayed at so far! And free WIFI!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but if allergic, don,t go here”
Reviews.Author: Fish_Diver_10
Reviews.Content: The title of my review is maybe a bit too negative, as I found the hotel quite good, the location very good for my purpose (I needed to be close to Circo Massimo), and the staff was very friendly. However, upon arrival in the room I was met by a dusty smell, normally I associate that to a smokers room, but later on I realized it was the full carpet in the room that had attracted so much dust (maybe mold) which resulted in the smell. You can imagine that I did not have the best sleep during my weeks stay there (I am allergic to dust). The bathroom was small but well laid out, shower was good, always hot water. The room was cleaned every day very well. The TV only showed Italian channels (at least I could not find any english speaking channels, which was a pity, as I would have liked to stay up to date with what was happening in Egypt). It was possible to connect to the internet, however, during peak hours (which unfortunately were when I arrived in the hotel) internet was very slow (almost impossible) as there was only one line, and therefore all guests were using that line during the same time (26 rooms I believe) All in all, I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and service”
Reviews.Author: compaygato
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here during a short business trip to Rome, and was very happy with it. The location is excellent; it's on a quiet street just 2 blocks from the Metro line B, and only about 10 or 15 minutes from Termini. There are lots of good restaurants about 6 or 7 blocks away in Testaccio, and it's a pleasant walk. The front desk workers were friendly, professional and helpful, and all spoke excellent English. Breakfast was very simple, but everything was good quality, particularly the coffee. The rooms were small and simple, but super clean and with all the basics well taken care of. My room had a small balcony overlooking a beautiful patio with orange trees, but unfortunately it was cold and rainy so I couldn't really take advantage. For the location and quality of service the hotel offers, I thought the price was an absolute steal. I'd happily come back next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Quiet, AND Central”
Reviews.Author: live2travel884
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice stay for us. The Aventine Area is like an oasis- so close to the Metro and the center and yet quiet- birds chirping, car free streets. The hotel is basic, clean enough, everything works. While the staff were a not exactly bubbly, they were nice and helpful when asked. Breakfast was good and the service there was great! The WiFi is free but the transmitter is in the basement so the signal in the breakfast room is great-in the rest of the hotel?- not so much.... There is no elevator but that was not a problem for us. Overall a great stay a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable and very friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Castor_Dioskouros
Reviews.Content: My stay happened at the time of the ash cloud in April 2010. Having been stuck in Israel there was a possibility to fly to Rome and then continue overland through Europe to Sweden. I booked the hotel without any prior knowledge of it. All I knew was that the location, the Aventine, is nice since I have spent a lot of time in Rome over the years. The hotel was truly a gem with an excellent location in a quiet residential area and yet within walking distance to areas like Testaccio with its many good restaurants. The staff was extremely helpful and did far more than anyone would have expected in helping us to book train tickets, somewhere to sleep in Munich and even the rental car with which we drove from Munich to Copenhagen! The room was nice, overlooking a wonderful walled garden and an old church. The view was actually very romantic and I think the hotel would suit couples interested in architectural history who, if they get the rooms with the little terraces, could sit there with a glass of wine and digest a day of sightseeing in the eternal city of Rome. The hotel was rather pricey, but Rome is not cheap and I would definitely choose stay there with my partner when I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: sophierose26
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in February for my boyfriends 21st. It is situated in a quiet mainly residential location but there is a metro stop 5 min walk away, which ran late into the night and we soon found a good route to walk to the Colluseum which only 20 mins. The room was small but really nicely decorated with gorgeous fixtures and the bathroom was wll equipped. The hotel is situated in a beautiful old buliding with a chapel next door and has a lovely small outside patio full of oranges trees (it was shut when we visited but i assume it opens in the summer.) Breakfast was minimal but fine for what we wanted. I wanted to write a review becasue we enjoyed our stay so much, a really lovely hotel and very good value for money. Sophie, 20, London.

Reviews.Title: “When you are tired of Rome, go the Aventine Hill and stay at the Hotel Domus Aventina”
Reviews.Author: kamp54
Reviews.Content: Located on the Aventine, a green and leafy residential neighborhood outside the Centro Storico, this hotel is sandwiched between a church and a grammar school. The rooms are large by Roman standards. My "single" was a king-size bed with a couch, a desk, a private terrace and a large bathroom. The breakfast room is large and well stocked. I have stayed there twice (2004 and 2010) and would stay there again. Only drawbacks were a moderately uncomfortable bed and pillow. Also, I have heard that there is no elevator, but on both occasions, I was on the first floor (which is up about 6 steps from the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price I paid”
Reviews.Author: xmolly25x
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice 3 star hotel and for the price i paid i couldnt have asked for more! Ok so its not smack bang in the city centre but anyone who claims its "too far" is either lazy or has expectations way too high. The hotel is set in a lovely residential part of the city, literally a few minutes walk from the tube station where you can hop on and off for something like a euro per day! Although it is easily within walking distance to everything- particularly the coliseum and the circus maximus which are approx a nice 10/15 minutes on foot from the hotel. The hotel itself is good, the rooms are a decent size for a hotel in Rome and we had the loveliest little balcony overlooking the garden and an old Roman church. Breakfast was nothing special but satisfactory for us, eggs/toast/cereal/yogurts/fruit and hot and cold drinks every morning. My only negative remark would be i didnt find the staff overly friendly, apart from the man serving breakfast who was lovely. All in all though i had a wonderful holiday and would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good quiet hotel for a relaxing break in a beautiful city :-)

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in quiet part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Skrubbetusse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here together with a group of friends. The hotel hadn't really understood we were a group, but that's probably because we'd made individual reservations online. We eventually got all the help we needed. Still, if you need a lot of service from your hotel (finding addresses, restaurants etc.) you should look elsewhere. Also, if you're looking for undisturbed comfort in your hotel room, this may not be your choice, as walls are paper thin. But if you're looking for a very reasonable priced hotel in the Aventine, this is a good choice. The location is also very good for visits to the Palatine and Forum Romanum/Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boston69
Reviews.Content: Been here for 3 nights. Lovely, clean,nice hotel. Great room and helpful staff. Thanks to it we had a great stay in Rome. I wholeheartedly recommend this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “bummer”
Reviews.Author: Roma2009Usa
Reviews.Content: We were very very very disappointed with Domus Aventina. Our trip to Rome was amazing, the sights, art, culture and food were incredible, we ate and ate and ate! The hotel was a long walk away from all of the attractions, shopping and food. The worst thing about the hotel was our room, the fabric covered walls were stained and musty, the bathroom was super small, breakfast was lousy, the staff were lazy, they didn't even offer to help us carry our bags to our room. Rome is a great city, I am sorry I had to stay in this dump while I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!! Deserves 1 star not 3.”
Reviews.Author: atravelergal
Reviews.Content: The hotel has beds and running water aside from that I see no other redeeming qualities. A true disappointment. The rooms were filthy as well as small. Completely inadequate. The staff was totally dismissive- no one was able to assist us with directions or general info regarding Rome. We tried to change hotels however all of the other places on the Aventine and surrounding area were booked. We stayed here several years ago and had a pleasant experience. The hotel has really declined. The hotel is in a great location and has potential if it gets a GUT renovation- until then save yourself the trouble, time and money. DON'T stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Generally, a satisfactory hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tony025
Reviews.Content: Generally satisfactory. The blurb says that 'every room' has a view over the courtyard ; every room that is except mine: room 47 - a small, but adequate single room which overlooks a different courtyard - the playground of the neighbouring primary school where they start playing at 8.00 a.m. when I booked some months ago there was a picture of, and mention of a roof terrace but this has now been removed from the website and was very definitely closed - a pity. Otherwise a good place if you want somewhere quiet away from the bustle of the centre. the Aventine is quiet and leafy residential area but only a few minutes walk from the Metro at Circo Massimo one way or to the river the other way where the 23 bus easily takes you to St Peter's / Castel Sant'Angelo area. Breakfast was very satisfactory

Reviews.Title: “Used to be better”
Reviews.Author: lucaerrante
Reviews.Content: Used to be a much nicer hotel a few years back; now a good restoration would do good. Anyway, is an intelligent choice for Rome, because it's quite out of the way, in a residential neighbourhood, it's cheap (130 euros/night, in August) and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, but near local attractions”
Reviews.Author: lilac66
Reviews.Content: The worst points of the hotel was the fact it was up a hill - not good for those going in August when the temp reached 35C plus. The breakfast was very basic, although the lady who served us hot drinks made lovely coffees and cappucinos. The room we had was basic - it had no balcony but in the heat this made little difference. The air con unit was very noisy, but kept us cool! The shower was annoying, the head kept moving out of position and was not very powerful. The good points were the location, 10-15 mins away from the Coloseum, if you can cope with sweltering temps. And the metro station Circo Massimo is a few mins walk away too taking you to all the main tourist hotspots. Staff were helpful and spoke good English. Our room was always clean and the hotel is set in a quiet location. Rome in general is not a good place to be in August - far too hot and a lot of Italians go on holiday during this time meaning that shops/bars etc were closed although this did not detract from the holiday itself. Overall a pleasant stay on a limited budget. Oh and there's no lift so don't bring bulky heavy bags with you, not recommended for disabled people as no disabled access.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent times at the Domus Aventina”
Reviews.Author: marcodimero
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome where we stayed at the Hotel Domus Aventina. Located 10 minutes walk from the Colosseum on a quiet residential street we found this an ideal place to explore the city away from all the hustle and bustle of the centro storico. The rooms are very clean and classy,the staff are very helpful and friendly and the continental breakfast is good. Our room opened out onto a terrace next to the Church of S.Prisca and was very attractive. A few tips would be to watch out for taxi drivers at Fiumicino airport trying to charge you 70 euros and head to the train station for an 8 euro ticket to Ostiense station which is not too far from the hotel. Also as you come out of the hotel most people will head down the road,turn left and head up to the Colosseum but if you come out the hotel,go right up the hill it leads round to the Circus Maximus and down to the beautiful old neighbourhood of Trastevere across the river. All in all i'd recommend this hotel and the beautiful city of Rome to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great value - Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: JamieD1981
Reviews.Content: a friend and I stayed at this hotel in May 09 and it was great. The front desk clerks during the day spoke english. It is up a large hill, but it was great exercise so I didn't mind too much. We ate at a cute little place at the bottom of the hill kiddy corner from the gas station 4 nights. Great service, amazing food and very good prices. Overall, I would very much recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Quiet!!! Yeahhhhhh....”
Reviews.Author: VidaLocaRanch
Reviews.Content: This small Hotel is a bit out of the way... fortunately! Rome is super busy. After a day of discovering Rome, shopping and walking for hours we were glad to find refuge away from the center. Close to bus tour, 15 min. to center. Had a nice room with terrasse, decent bedding, great shower. Poor breakfast and unreliable internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short stay--especially for meetings at FAO”
Reviews.Author: DC-IMF-FAOtraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel room for a single was small, but I was very comfortable. The room was a bit cold but the staff was very helpful and provided nice warm wool blankets right away. The breakfast was good--yogurt, cereal, eggs, warm pastries, juices, and coffee made to order. The hotel will arrange for a ride to and from the airport--and the services were very prompt and friendly No restaurant, but there are restaurants and a grocery store not to far. FAO/Circo Maximo is only a 5 min walk. I would stay there because its a nice quiet area. There are a few boutiques, gelaterias, and cafes. The Vespa store is worth a look!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: BobbyBunny
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel from which to explore the many highlights of Rome. Situated in a quiet residential area but within easy walking distance of the main tourist sites. The room was spacious with a patio area opening on to a pleasant courtyard. Very clean and well maintained with maid service every day. The buffet breakfast was of a very high standard and more than adequate. Only a short distance to a main bus stop and a 7 or 8 minute walk to the metro station. Overall, we were extremely satisfied with our stay and would definately consider using again for a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very nice”
Reviews.Author: gsa1951
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from April 18th to the 23rd. The hotel is located in a very quiet, residential area next to a school and church. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. Two of the staff spoke fluent English to go along with my choppy Italian, the night clerk spoke very little. The room was very nice and large enough to actually sleep three, there was a pullout sleeper should we had needed one. We had a view of the courtyard, which is actually the picture they show on line, however that was off limits to the public and the roof top garden was also closed. The location also had access to a few restaurants and cafes which provided a nice respite from busy Rome, one in particular was excellent, Grottino de Rino, which is right on Aventino, we had great meal that did not break the bank. At breakfast do not expect typical American fare, you get bread, croissants, juice, hard boiled eggs, cereal and pre packaged cheese and little pates. The cappuccino was excellent. One note of caution, the hotel is not handicap friendly, no elevator and we were on the third floor so after walking up a hill to get the hotel we had three flights of stairs to get through, and after wine and food it was sometimes a challenge. We would definitely stay here again though

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Doches
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March, 2009 and really liked it. The hotel is very clean, the rooms are very comfortable and the service is great. We wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. It is in a beautiful neighborhood and there are restaurants, grocery stores, etc. a few blocks away at the bottom of the hill. The hotel is adjacent to St. Prisca church, which was built in 489 AD. The neighborhood is historic and a few blocks away is the Church of Santa Sabina, one of Rome's oldest churches. The Circus Maximus is also only a few blocks way. A bus stop and Metro are short distances away.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: glossoptripper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a monday to friday city break. We had booked the hotel on the recomendation of other Tripadvisor reports and we were not disappointed. Our bedroom was on the first floor and was a very generous sized room, very clean and nicely decorated with a small balcony overlooking a courtyard with a magnificent magnolia tree in full bloom. The hotel is in a tranquil and exclusive part of the city, very peaceful and away from the traffic noise yet within easy walking distance of all the attractions apart from the Vatican and St Peters. The hotel staff were very friendly and all spoke excellent English. There are a number of reasonably priced restaurants within 5 minutes of the hotel but try the Jewish restaurants in the old ghetto near Isolo Tiberina (Tiber Island). We were considering a trip to see Pompey but on the recomendation of the reception desk we went instead to Ostia Antica, Romes old port and just a short rail journey from Ostiense railway station half a mile from the hotel, excellent choice instead of Pompey. Our other tip, if you are there on a short break, buy a Roma Pass 23 Euros each but you get entry to 2 historical free, reduced rates at all other sites and free bus and rail travel on the cities transport system, a steal at 23 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for the price (why pay more?)”
Reviews.Author: LocalRunner
Reviews.Content: * First time in ROMA, and this hotel was great! Everything as I expected. Smotth check in, clean rooms, great continental breakfast. Great little balcony. No complaints (for a price of CAD$175/night, that's amazing). * The hotel itself is situated in Aventino Hill which is a beautiful walk in itself. After dinner, just walk off the meal around the neighborhood. * From FCO airport, the easiest is the shuttle service (available at the Tourist Info centre by the train station (which is connected to the Airport). Costs $15EUR/person. Compare with finding the hotel yourself ($5.50EUR train ride + $1.00EUR bus ride). Shuttle is more than double, but I think it's reasonable if it's your first time there. We used the shuttle back to the airport also. * Once at the hotel, remember bus #175! That will be your key to the city! * Maybe different for everyone, but I think buying the $1EUR for 75 mins of bus/subway is better because in Rome, I found I did a lot of walking anyways. You use the public transit for longer hauls, but that is not too often! It's $4EUR for day pass, and I think $11EUR for 3 days, etc.. * Potential drawbacks: * Hotel is in between subway stations (Circo Massimo and Paramide stations. * Shower is really small, but managable. * Bed is actually two doubles stuck together, but not a big problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great at the Domus Aventina”
Reviews.Author: isoldeInverness
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip abroad without my wife and was worried about how I would be treated as a single person. There was no problem. I would agree with all the positive comments about the Domus Aventina. The single room was quite adequate for my needs and thank-goodness for the air-con and plenty of cool water in the shower. I found the restaurant "da Rino" near Circus Maximus very good and Taverna Cestia near the Piramide excellent. Would recommend the hotel to anyone wanting a quiet stay but within easy reach of all the "sites"

Reviews.Title: “an oasis in rome”
Reviews.Author: flamengoToronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect escape from the heat and intensity of summer in Rome. A tranquil, peaceful place to recharge your batteries. The rooms are quite spacious (for a euro hotel), have an AC system that works very well, bed was very comfortable, although the bathroom is small (but was fine for my tastes). Best of all, the rooms have wonderful balconies, overlooking a church courtyard. Perfect place to unwind. The staff are excellent-- friendly and helpful (and speak good english). Breakfast emphasizes the functional over the flashy, but was perfect start for my busy days here.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly...”
Reviews.Author: BostonOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: ..I am not sure what I missed that other travelers did not. I had to move rooms 2 times before finally settling on one that was just decent. First room was dark and musty with an odd closet like door that led to a strange patio of highwalled nothingness. Second room, although less musty, had ant issues. I went out to tour the Coliseum and came back to baby ants crawling on the food on my desk. Later at night they were crawling all around my feet on the floor and up furniture. The front desk folks were nice about it and I was moved up yet another floor to a large room, less musty than the previous but with big worn, dirt spots next to the bed. I put a towel down to cover it and finally surrendered to the Domus Aventina. Also, the roof patio (one of the reasons I booked at the Domus) is no longer. This hotel has a repuation for a great view (Rick Steves) that you can't actually enjoy. However, there were many positives. -the hotel common areas were renovated and nice. -bathrooms were new; nice and clean. -breakfast buffet was good. they run out of eggs early and don't seem to replenish them. small, packaged cookies and crackers are available; take some for your day's excursion or for snacks in the room later. -breakfast and housekeeping teams are very, very nice. -neighborhood is quaint, safe and in a great location. you get a nice feel for life outside of tourist land. walking around the area in the evening i was able to watch a beautiful ballet lesson of young girls in the school yard. -it is next to a church for those who want to sit in on a worship service. -the hotel is a 10 min walk to the coliseum and a very short bus ride to the catacombs. take a right after exiting the front door and you will come to the rose garden which you can cut through to see many other sites (orange garden, shortcut to other main streets). -close to the supermarket and subway station. Perhaps the room thing was just an issue in the singles. But if you can pack your agenda full of activities that limit your time in the rooms Domus Aventina may not be that bad to you.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jpmgalway
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay in Rome. This hotel is located close to Circo Massimo metro station. 3 stops from Terminii station. On leaving the station cross the road and turn left. At the supermarket you can pick up bottled water for 30 cent rather than the 2.50 euro charged by the hotel. Carry on until you reach the petrol station, turn right hotel is on the right. The staff are friendly and rooms comfortable though I did find the shower cubicle a bit small. Breakfast is served 0700 to 1030. There are no facilities to make a hot drink in the room which was a litlle disappointing. Overall I would be happy to recommend this hotel to friends and family. I noticed a big difference in prices for booking this hotel so make use of tripadvisor.com! If you want to eat near the hotel at a reasonable price we found Insalata Ricca to be good. It's on the opposite side of the road from the petrol station at 3-5 Via Albania only a couple of minutes from the hotel. A taxi from the hotel to terminii station cost 12 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room (get room 37, GREAT BALCONY)!”
Reviews.Author: minnesotatravelgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a very posh area of Rome, a bit off the beaten path, but very near Circus Maximus and about a 1 mile walk (downhill) to the Coliseum. Pros: *Rooms are larger than average for Rome *Rooms get cleaned everyday *If you have a room with a balcony, the view is AMAZING!!! *Rooms have mini-bars/refridgerators, which is nice for storing your water bottles, food, etc. *There are a few stores up the street, along with a few pizza restaurants Cons: *If you are not fluent in Italian, learn useful phrases before staying here - most of the staff struggle to speak English *Small, stand up showers only - after walking in Rome (which is A LOT OF WALKING!!!) a hot bath would have been awesome... *Pigeons pigeons and more pigeons...before you hang out on your terrace, you will need to clean the table and chairs!!! *When you leave, take a hotel card with you...if you should end up in a taxi at the end of the day, show them the address so you can return to your room...most taxi drivers speak very little English...but this is not a con (taxi to hotel from Spanish Steps and Trevi area is between 8-9 Euro). Overall this is a great little inn. The price is great and I highly recommend exploring the hilly area of Aventine Hill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2072
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. It is ideally located near Circus Maximus and has a public bus stop 200 feet from the hotel. The rooms are large by European standards and the breakfast buffet was great. The staff helped us find various historical sites and assisted us in determining the best way to access the sites using public transportation. The neighborhood also felt very safe. The U.S., Norweigan, and British Ambassadors live within a few hundred feet of the hotel so there is a constant police presence in the neighborhood. This hotel is bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sam138
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while on a long weekend in Rome. It served its purpose well with the benefits of a good location and comfortable rooms. Rome is a fantastic city with so much to do, and for this reason there is no need to spend a fortune on a hotel with amenities which you will never use. Location: (Walking) Coliseum- 5min Palatine Hill- 5min Trevi Fountain- 25min Spanish Steps- 30min Vatican- 40min Restaurants- 10-15min Rooms: Large Free safe Nice bathroom, only shower. TV-BBC World Ample storage Air con & Heater for winter I landed at Ciampino airport and got a Terevision coach (8eruos) to Termini (main station) in city centre. From here I took the Line B metro to Cirus Maximo (1euro from ticket machine). Cross the main road and walk up hill towards a large statue, before reaching it turn left past the US Embassy and follow the road to a main junction. From here turn right for the hotel. There are loads of coaches running to and from termini/Ciampino like Terevision and Shuttle Bus. These are cheap and safe. I didn’t use a taxi once in 4 days and still easily managed to get to and from airport and see all of Rome. For nice restaurants try side streets round the Cavour metro area e.g. Via Madonna St. Also side streets off main Viale Trastevere road. I found Rome to be very safe at night and had no hesitation when using the merto.

Reviews.Title: “did not honor reservation...but good location”
Reviews.Author: colonial2
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel for a 3 night stay. It was easy to find using our gps and close enough to major attrations to make us content. However, when we checked in, we were taken to a tiny roon with no baclony. When my husband went back the the front desk, he told them we'd booked (and paid the upgrade for) a non-smoking balcony room. The front desk apologized and put us in a large room with a balcony...but it was smoking....and it smelled terrible.... SO my husband went back to the front desk and nicely pointed out we'd paid for a non-smoking balcony room and that's what we expected....we were told they did not have any available (maybe not at all, I'm not sure) and were told we could stay in the smoking room (not an option for me) or move to a bigger non-smoking room...but not get the balcony we paid for. So all in all I was displeased and was not compensated for not recieving the balacony. I would have been more flexible if we'd only been staying one night, but because we were staying three nights I was very dissatisfied by the hotel's inability or unwillingness to honour the reservation we'd paid for.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ginger68
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful holiday in rome staying at the domus aventina hotel. The hotel was clean comfortable and great value for money. The continental breakfast was superb fresh rolls croisants tea or coffee juice all fresh and very tasty. This was a great value for money hotel and i would recommend it highly. The colloseum is only a 10 min walk and there are buses and trains to centre of rome nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for its category”
Reviews.Author: glukos
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for its category ( 3 star). We got a nice clean room with private veranda, and an air condition that was working ( important when its hot) . The staff at the reception gave a very good impression, and gave good service. Also the woman in the breakfast room gave good service. Breakfast is a bit basic, and I missed fresh fruit. The hotel has no restaurant, but there are many restaurants around. There is no bellboy or elevator, but I didnt have a problem carrying my suitcase up. The hotel is located in a nice area, and its very easy to walk to diferent places to city center, to colloseum , to trastevere. You feel safe walking at night. It is also very easy to get to take the train to Ostiense then take bus 175 to stop via d.terme deciane, and its a very short walk from there.. All in all I found it to be a good hotel for its category, paid USD 132 at asiarooms.com which is not a bad price for rome

Reviews.Title: “Good sized room and air cond was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Syd.tigger
Reviews.Content: We were provided a big room (room 28) but it smells terrible (smells of old cigarettes) You do get use to it and the room is clean enough ( a bit 60s feeling ) and the great thing is that the air cond works! There is an in room safe, mini bar (we just stocked it with tap water in bottles and with some cakes etc we had bought from a supermarket). The bathroom has a bidet (which we don't know how to use so have been avoiding) and has a tub/shower etc. There is NO view at all as we are on the ground floor and the windows are frosted and high up (and don't slide open). We have free wireless internet ( you have to ask at reception for the details as it requires a fixed IP address). The breakfast is pretty good for a continental breakfast. Definitely catch the 175 from/to the termini. The added benefit of the 175 is that it has air cond (I know I'm harping on it .. but it's 35degrees + out there -- celcius). There is no where nearby to get the bus tickets so stock up when you are out and about. On the way in we walked from Cicus Maximo station stop and it's tough with suitcases up and down stairs (station and near the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TonyWales
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with all the positive reviews I have read on the hotel and say my three night stay was perfect. The only warning I would give is not to take up the option of their limousine service as it costs 55 euros while a taxi from Ciampino Airport is a fixed rate 30 euros. Our double room on the top floor overlooked a quiet courtyard with orange and lemon trees while in the four days there never heard the church bell once. The shower cubicle is close fitting but that's just a minor fault while the breakfast of boiled eggs, cereal, bread, jams and cheese with great coffee was a good start to the day. Also you can get anywhere on foot from the hotel, even the Vatican, a 40-minute walk. You must turn right from the hotel and down the hill to get to the banks of the Tiber for the Vatican. Piazza Navona and Pantheon etc while Fontana dei Trevi, Colleseum, Forum, Spanish Steps etc would be better with a left hand turn and follow the main road. Also great eating across the Tiber in Trastevere is just a 15 minute walk away. It's highly recommended you eat here as the choice of restaurants are by far the best in Rome with great places for pizzas, pastas and seafood to choose from. If you can get book this hotel in advance for the great price we did I would definitely recommend it as its the perfect location for visiting the sights and the area is certainly safe at night.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: Davy75
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel for 3 nights from the 15th February until the 17th February 2007. The Hotel is situated next to a church and looked lovely. However the room that was allocated to us was in a corner. All that was there was a double bed with hardly any space and the room was damp. There were doors that went into a Courtyard but this was the only plus point as far as we could see as when you back into the room it was very hot The rooms are soundproofed but we were woken up by the tv from the room next door. It is however handy for all the tourists sites.

Reviews.Title: “Concrete pillows!!”
Reviews.Author: tvluk
Reviews.Content: We have just spent three nights at this hotel, for one reason I would not stay here again. The beds and pillows were the most uncomfortable that we had ever slept on. 5 of us stayed, and after the first night we all agreed that we felt like we had spent the night with our heads resting on blocks of concrete. It was awful. One room was a triple and the person was on a fold out sofa. The matress was so thin they had the frame of the sofa digging in to them all night. On the second day we all requested new pillows, they were not much better but we were able to bend them and twist them until they each had a reasonably comfortable corner. Bedding and pillows are obviosuly very personal choices and some people may have found these perfect, but we were all exhausted from lack of decent sleep. Apart from the bedding the hotel was fine. The rooms were clean and breakfast was ok. No hot food, but plenty of yoghurts, cereal and pastries. There is no lift in the hotel, so pack lightly. We walked everywhere from the hotel, even the Vatican City. It took about 15 minutes to walk to the Colosseum. Unfortunately though the bedding ruined this hotel for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: harrogate_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 5th until the 8th Jan 2007. We were both really pleased with the hotel. Our room was a great size, and a big balcony. Our room was clean and the maid came every day that we stayed. I agree with a previous review saying that the cubical is a little small, but is still perfectly useable. The breakfast was nice, the usual continental style with cereal, crossiants, pastries, bread, cheese, yoghart etc. The location was good apporx 10 minutes walk to the Colleseum, very close to the underground station Circo Massimo. The staff were helpful when we asked about transportation and the best way to get to sights. We got a shuttle bus from the Airport (6 Euros)to Termini then a taxi to the hotel which cost 10 euros. Going back we got the tube to Termini (1 Euro each). Also easy walking distance to the old jewish area, also know as the old Ghetto. We had a great meal in an italian restaurant there. I have already recommendid this hotel to others and would stay their again. I noticed it is more expensive to book via their own website and much cheaper via expedia or hotels .com. (half price at the time I booked)

Reviews.Title: “OK, but would want a better room next time!”
Reviews.Author: Holidays06
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location, and very quiet. Our room was a little dissapointing (Room 28) The hotels own info pack says 'all rooms have a balcony / terrace' - well ours had two head height windows which were of frosted glass. We therefore had little natural light in the room which resulted in a rather musty feel. We asked to be moved, but was told the hotel was full. We had a simlar issue with the air-con as a previous advisor noted - it seemed to go off after around 30 mins, regardless of how long you set it for. Luckily it was not to hot at night, so after initally cooling the room, we didn't need it on again. Although generally unhappy with the room, it was of a good size, with lots of storage space. The breakfast was fairly minimal, even for continental standards. The rolls were fresh, but there was only a choice of jams or meat paste - no cheeses or fresh meats and fruits. Overall the hotel was acceptable - clean, tidy with polite staff. If we'd had a room with a better view, it may have improved our overall opinion of it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great doubles, poor singles”
Reviews.Author: MigsOfWigs
Reviews.Content: I got a taxi from Termini to the hotel at 23.30 hrs for 15 Euros. Make sure to get a taxi from the official rank in front of the station, not from the touts all over the place. Had I known where i was going and been earlier I would have got the 175 bus from stop "i" at the front of Termini. It served me well during my stay and i bought a weekly ticket from the small Tabac/Lotto shop down the hill from the hotel across the busy road. You only have to punch the ticket on the ticket machine on the bus once then you can go on trains and buses for a week without having to punch it again. My thanks to the earlier reviewer who gave good info on this bus. As I arrived late and the single room i'd booked was taken, I was given an excellent double room overlooking the church. Breakfast was average the next day, no fruit or meats (why not, for the price?) but they had eggs and good cereals, toast etc and friendly guy running it. Then i was asked to move to a single room. It was not a good room, it overlooked a drain and walls only and smelt mildly of the drain. The bathroom was not in a good state, with some mould on the shower wall. I had asked for a room at end of corridor and this was it, room 27. It was quiet anyway. The main part of the room was clean and i couldn't be bothered to move again. Service was ok at the desk and a good gym at the school next door can be used for 8 Euros. Rome so magnificent i didn't care too much about the hotel but if you're on your own consider staying elsewhere. Michael, London

HotelInfo.Name: Domus Aventina
HotelInfo.Address: Via di Santa Prisca 11/b, 00153 Rome, Italy
